properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 18 at 2:57AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
A period of heavy snow overnight followed by rain later today
will cause rises on the rivers flowing off the Olympics. Heavy
snow will be followed by rain and could drive the Skokomish River
up near flood stage. The snow level will rise as high as 4000
feet by the end of the storm. Depending on the rainfall total,
increase in snow level, and potential melting of low elevation
snow in the valleys, minor flooding is possible on the Skokomish
as a result.

Please continue to monitor the latest forecast for the next few
days. Details of potential flooding will change as the situation
evolves.

Latest river forecasts available at
water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=sew

NWSheadline: RIVER FLOODING IS POSSIBLE BY SUNDAY FOR THE SKOKOMISH RIVER IN MASON COUNTY
